TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content: Is there any way to disable the terminator visible in orbit on Kerbin and other planets, like in RSSVE’s scatterer? I don’t really like the look of it, looks pretty unrealistic to me. ![:/](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/ZNGIcon1.png ":/")

> 
> 
> 43 minutes ago, Galileo said:
> 
> 
> Awesome thanks!
> 

Done, new version up.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, TheKurgan said:
> 
> 
> Ocean shaders off. Much better. You can still see the sky and clouds, but it's usable.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [Ocean Shaders off](https://youtu.be/wL2SVMbmLm4)
> 

How was it before 1.4.2? Was it not like this?

> 
> 
> 14 minutes ago, Dankgum said:
> 
> 
> Is there any way to disable the terminator visible in orbit on Kerbin and other planets, like in RSSVE’s scatterer? I don’t really like the look of it, looks pretty unrealistic to me. ![:/](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/ZNGIcon1.png ":/")
> 

Play with the cloud extinction value in scatterer settings.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, blackrack said:
> 
> 
> How was it before 1.4.2? Was it not like this?﻿
> 

Maybe... ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

But I was able to have the ocean shaders on. The great looking ocean is 50% of the reason I use Scatterer.

I'll run my 1.3.1 install, and compare.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-04-27T02:02:50Z" title="04/27/2018 02:02  AM" data-short="6 yr">April 27, 2018</time> by TheKurgan**

so.. using the latest 1.4.x, but.. ever since the most recent update, my sky is black (regardless of time of day) and in orbit, all of the planets are completely black.. doesn't matter what other visual mods I use in conjunction with it, either.  previous versions did not have this issue.

[@blackrack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104258-blackrack/) You're the man !  

You did it. Using KSP 1.4.3 including the DLC now and the last Scatterer files - all the weird dark and reddish atmospheric colorings together with the dimmed sun (Kerbol) that were occuring with root-parts using B9PartSwitch and with the Mk3 BlockII cockpit from Cormorant Aeronology (which doesn't use B9PartSwitch) are gone for me. Splendid! ![:kiss:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_kiss.gif ":kiss:")

>

> 50 minutes ago, Beetlecat said:
> 
> 
> Lots of fiddling with the new Kopernicus, and my stack of visual mods this morning (to figure out why I suddenly lost ~25fps...) and I finally noticed the "missing night sky" issue;
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I fired up a stock game (WIN x64, no special DX string [DX9?]) with scatterer-only, and confirm that it goes away when disabling the ocean refraction. It also goes away if you zoom out far enough from the active craft. Same thing happens in Space Center view (with refraction on) -- zooming \*in\* will make the sky disappear. Maybe this has more to do with the camera/viewpoint "altitude," since zooming out along the ground didn't affect it, but zooming out far enough basically puts you up into the atmosphere/space where the regular transition to skybox happens.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> A real shame about those hard cuts from night->dawn dusk->night, though. Have they honestly always been like that? Maybe the sky hasn't been pretty enough to stare at until mods came along. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")
> 

The hard transition is in stock too

> 
>

I'll check.  I'm not a big fan of sunflare in general; I may have turned it off.  I'll report back tomorrow if it still works.  If I have to choose between the sky issue and a working sunflare though, I'll take a fixed sky ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")  

Now I have to see why my framerates, even in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>/<abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr>, got suddenly so much worse;  that may be AVP, though.  going back to standard <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>/etc and will see if that makes a difference.

So, I'm hoping there's a setting that will allow me to adjust the flare's location. Is this even a scatterer issue or is it cause by something on the Kopernicus side?
